did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: National Federation of Grain Cooperatives records, 1946-1976.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Legislation; congressional committee hearings, comments, and press releases regarding agriculture law and legislation; press releases of farmers' associations; correspondence concerning laws, taxation, etc.; material on cooperatives and associations; records of commodity prices; newsletters, reports, memos, etc. concerning import quotas; material on the Uniform Grain Storage Agreement; and other records of agricultural associations and laws and regulations affecting agriculture. Persons named in the records include Martin Abraham Abrahamsen, Dean Acheson, George David Aiken, Carl Bert Albert, John A. Baker, Louis Hyman Bean, Ezra Taft Benson, Walter C. Berger, John Bird, Mortimer Maxwell Caplin, John Alexander Carroll, J.M. Chambers, Willard W. Cochrane, Lloyd H. Davis, Douglas Dillon, Robert J. Dole, Paul Douglas, Milton Stover Eisenhower, Paul L. Farris, William Farris, Orville L. Freeman, Guy Mark Gillette, H.D. Godfrey, Roy F. Hendrickson, Hubert Humphrey, Dr. A. Ladru Jensen, C. Warner Johnson, Edwin Clark Johnson, Lyndon B. Johnson, Robert Samuel Kerr, William Leonard Langer, Catharine May, Fred Maywald, Eugene J. McCarthy, Wilbur D. Mills, Karl E. Mundt, Charles S. Murphy, Lawrence F. O'Brien, Albert H. Quie, Don L. Short, Edward John Thye, Thomas F. Toohey, Horace Jeremiah Voorhis, Henry Agard Wallace, John Clarence Watts, and Jamie L. Whitten.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Legislation; congressional committee hearings, comments, and press releases regarding agriculture law and legislation; press releases of farmers' associations; correspondence concerning laws, taxation, etc.; material on cooperatives and associations; records of commodity prices; newsletters, reports, memos, etc. concerning import quotas; material on the Uniform Grain Storage Agreement; and other records of agricultural associations and laws and regulations affecting agriculture. Persons named in the records include Martin Abraham Abrahamsen, Dean Acheson, George David Aiken, Carl Bert Albert, John A. Baker, Louis Hyman Bean, Ezra Taft Benson, Walter C. Berger, John Bird, Mortimer Maxwell Caplin, John Alexander Carroll, J.M. Chambers, Willard W. Cochrane, Lloyd H. Davis, Douglas Dillon, Robert J. Dole, Paul Douglas, Milton Stover Eisenhower, Paul L. Farris, William Farris, Orville L. Freeman, Guy Mark Gillette, H.D. Godfrey, Roy F. Hendrickson, Hubert Humphrey, Dr. A. Ladru Jensen, C. Warner Johnson, Edwin Clark Johnson, Lyndon B. Johnson, Robert Samuel Kerr, William Leonard Langer, Catharine May, Fred Maywald, Eugene J. McCarthy, Wilbur D. Mills, Karl E. Mundt, Charles S. Murphy, Lawrence F. O'Brien, Albert H. Quie, Don L. Short, Edward John Thye, Thomas F. Toohey, Horace Jeremiah Voorhis, Henry Agard Wallace, John Clarence Watts, and Jamie L. Whitten.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: National Federation of Grain Cooperatives records, #2940. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

Series II. Series II. Co-op Taxes
Series III. Series III. Import Quotas
Series IV. Series IV. Uniform Grain Storage Agreement (UGSA)
Series V. Series V. Assorted Materials
Series VI. Series VI. Chronological Files

did.unittitle: Agricultural Act: "Prosperity and Progress for the Farmer and Rural America"

scopecontent.p: Pres LBJ, statement, 18pp, plus summary statement
Legislative bills
Congress Record, Senate and House debates and comments
Clippings; press releases; bills; memos; statements; House Committee on Agriculture; wheat; Secretary of Agriculture; Senate Committee on Agricultre and Forestry; Bob Dole, M.C., Kansas
Copies, Public Law 88-297,regarding cotton and wheat (multiple copies)
House Committee on Agriculture
Public Law 88-26, Feed Grain Act (copies); hearings; Feed Grain Act 1963; miscellaneous statements and reports regarding agriculture and wheat
Correspondence; memo.; regarding the act; Hubert Humphrey; Milton R. Young; National Council of Farmer Cooperatives; Kerr Grain Corporation, Oregon
Bills and messages regarding Act of 1962

Bills; statements; correspondence regarding 1962 Act: Roy F. Hendrickson statement; Orville L. Freeman before Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry; National Association of Wheat Growers, Glen L. Bayne, President; National Council of Farmer Cooperatives; Press Release, National Farmers Union
Bills regarding Act of 1962
Bills, mostly, regarding Act of 1961

did.unittitle: Agricultural Act -- USDA, President J. Kennedy

scopecontent.p: Testimony, statements, memo., press releases, regarding Act of 1961; O.L. Freeman; "Last working draft" Administration Confidential Agricultural Bill; Testimony, O.L. Freeman, Senate Agricultural Committee; E.M. Norton, national Milk Producers Federation before Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry

Statements regarding: Cooperative League of the USA, Jerry Voorhis to Senator Paul Douglas, letter, Canton, South Dakota, regarding legislation; Albert Lowenfels, NY State; National Association of Wheat Growers, before House Committee on Agriculture
Correspondence regarding Farm Bill, either positive, negative, neutral
"Wheat Marketing Act of 1960" description, 5 pp. memo
Press releases, statements regarding National Farmers Union, House Subcommittee on Wheat; Pres. Eisenhower's Message to Congree; Farm Legislation
Congressional record; bills; statements; press releases regarding Act; Gordon Roth; memos regarding surplus, wheat, and House Representative Edward J. Thye, Minnesota
Bills, statements, press releases regarding Act
Correspondence, press releases, statements regarding Act; M.W. Thatcher, President, NFGC to Roy F. Hendrickson St. Paul

Press releases, reports, clippings, correspondence regarding 1954; includes "Appraisal of the Agricultural Acts of 1948 and 1949 … by Ezra T. Benson … (by) Iowa State College …" Mimeograph( June 4, 1953) 8 pp.; correspondents: Edward J. Thye, Senate, Minnesota, Harold D. Cooley, House, N. Caroline, R.F.H to Clifford R. Hope, House, Kansas
Congressional record, clippings, correspondence regarding Act; USDA Milton R. Young, Senate, N. Dakota (copy of letter Apr. 14, 1953) regarding parity prices
Bills regarding Act
Mostly correspondence including Harold D. Cooley, House, N. Carolina regarding parity; Milton R. Young, Senate, N. Dakota regarding "Young-Russell" bill
Text of the Act
Text of the Act; also Roy F. Hendrickson to M.W. Thatcher on the Act (Nov. 6, 1948); 2 pp. plus 10 pp. comments on agricultural situation

Includes registration list of attendees and 3 copies "Legislative Background of the New Tax Treatment of Cooperatives and their Patrons" by John E. Noakes, New York (Nov. 19-20, 1962), Washington D.C. 9 pp. + 2 pp. footnotes

did.unittitle: Co-op Taxes, H R 13103 -- Foreign Investors Tax Act of 1966

scopecontent.p: Includes bill and Roy F. Hendrickson letters to Eugene McCarthy, Senate, Minnesota, and Frank Carlson, Senate, Kansas regarding section 212 which relates to cooperatives

did.unittitle: Co-op Taxes, Cooperative Marketing Association, Kansas City

scopecontent.p: Mostly correspondence regarding IRS and CMA and income tax exemption status
Copy of Cache Valley Case, 1965; copy of "Farmers' Cooperative Income Tax Returns for 1953" IRS

Correspondence regarding cooperatives and taxation with Kansas Farmers' Service Association and memo from Nieman and Bosard, Attorneys, Minneapolis regarding "the question of income tax on government business"
Protest and covering letter regarding taxing of copperatives with protest from The Cooperative Elevator and Supply Company, Meade, Kansas, 23 pp., Confidential
Mostly correspondence regarding Interal Revenue and cooperatives, and matter of capital retains
Includes memos from Roy F. Hendrickson to Directors; and copies of Federal Register

Telegrams, resolutions, regarding cooperative taxes; National Council of Farmer Cooperatives, Homer L. Brinkely, W.E. Rumble (St. Paul, Attorneys), Cooperative League of the United States, Jerry Voorhis (Ex Director)
NFGC Directors regarding amendment to HR 10650, Texas, Kansas, Iowa; Correspondence with Nebraksa, New York, etc.
Statement, W.E. Rumble (Apr 16, 1962) before Senate, Committee on Finance, 10 pp. mimeograph

Mostly correspondence to and from Dr. A Ladru Jensen, Attorney, Salt Lake City regarding taxation of cooperatives including "Summary of Revenue Act of Oct 1962 As it Applies to Cooperatives" 5 pp.; also 6 pp. mimeograph statement/letter from Ladru to Senator Wallace F. Bennett (May 7, 1962) regarding HR 10650; National Rural Electric Cooperative Association; National Council of Farmer Cooperatives
Mr. Max M. Kampelman, Attorney, Washington, memo to Senator Eugene McCarthy (June 16, 1962), 6 pp., plus 2 pp. supplemental (copy) memo is regarding HR 10650 and taxation of cooperatives
Includes copy of letter sent to Senators Robert S. Kerr, Eugene McCarthy, Frank Carlson, Carl T. Curtis regarding Senator Clinton Anderson proposal of taxing cooperatives
National Council of Farmer Cooperatives and HR 10650 correspondence and memos
Some literature of the National Tax Equality Association (1962) and article of taxing cooperatives which appeared in the READERS DIGEST (Feb 1962)

Mostly statement, Douglas Dillon, Ways and Means Committee (May 3, 1961), subject is taxation; also Roy F. Hendrickson newsletter on taxes (Apr 21, 1961); and press release, White House, "Message on Taxation" (Apr 20, 1961)

did.unittitle: Co-op Taxes - House, Ways and Means Committee

scopecontent.p: Includes Roy F. Hendrickson to Wilbur D. Mills, House, and also RGH newsletter (Jan 20, 1959); and Frank G Rankin, Manager, Golf Proof Elevator, Louisville, Kentucky to Roy F. Hendrickson (Nov 20, 1958) regarding Representative John C. Watts, Kentucky, and Mr. Clarence L. Miller, Assistant Secretary of Agriculture, regarding their stand on cooperatives (Watts and Miller) "good for agriculture"
Statement, W.E. Rumble before Ways and Means Committee, mimeograph, 25 pp.
Statement, W.E. Rumble, Ways and Means Committee, 6 pp., mimeograph
Statement, W.E. Rumble, Taxation and cooperatives, 29 pp. mimeo.
Statement, Congressional Record regarding taxation
Statement, Congressional Record regarding taxation
Statement of Karl D. Loos (Feb 23, 1950) before Ways and Means Committee, 35 pp., 3 tables, mimeo
Correspondence, other items regarding hearing
Roy F. Hendrickson, newsletter, 30 pp. , mimeograph regarding IRS proposed regulations regarding cooperative taxes
Correspondence (2 letters) between Roy F. Hendrickson and Robert C. Guenzel, Attorney, Lincoln regarding cooperatives and IRS
Bill, HR 4370 (Feb 4, 1965)
Some correspondence and briefs regarding Northwest Agricultural Cooperative Association v. ICC, Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals (Aug 10, 1965)

Mostly correspondence regarding letter Mr. Lester R. McDonald, Farmers Elevator and Merchandise Company, Satanta, Kansas to Representative Floyd Breeding, 5th District, Kansas (May 16, 1958) regarding taxation of cooperatives that they should be taxed; Roy F. Hendrickson assisted in reply from Breeding to McDonald

Correspondence, clippings, pamphlets; includes letter, James G. Patton to Roy F. Hendrickson (Mar 19 1956) saying they should visit tax problems and "concerned that we may have some substantially punitive legislation if this crows stays in office"; Confidential Report on Conference on United Action for Tax Justice, Chicago (Oct 12, 1956), 6 pp. mimeo; Roy F. Hendrickson (May 24, 1956) Draft of Proposed Tax Amendment (Confidential) to Directors; Senator Hubert H. Humphrey to Roy F. Hendrickson; (Dec. 30, 1955) regarding taxation of cooperatives

Correspondence, reports, bills regarding tax legislation; includes Homer L. Brinkley to Roy F.H. and others (Mar 16, 1956) on meeting with members; Ways and Means (Cooper, Mills, Boggs, and Daniel A. Reed) states their feelings on current legislation before them; 2pp confidential
Correspondence and draft of proposed tax legislation from National Council of Farmer Cooperatives
Correspondence, newsletters, clippings regarding taxation of cooperatives

did.unittitle: Co-op Taxes - Commodity Credit Corporation grain

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memos, reports regarding Commodity Credit Corporation; Roy F. Hendrickson, Fred Maywald, Farmers Grain Dealers Association, Des Moines
Ways and Means Committee hearings; W.E. Rumble and Roy F. Hendrickson some good letters regarding hearings (Jan 1958); some copies of statements, some publications
Correspondence; copies from Congressional Record
Correspondence regarding Westcentral and Maywood (Nebraska) cooperative tax cases
Commodity prices
Dan H. McVey, Chief, Grain Branch, USDA, 6 mimeograph reports on grain cooperatives throughout the U.S.
4 mimeo, reports on grain cooperatives, United States
Correspondence, memos, editorials; series of memos and letters to M.W. Thatcher, General Manager, Farmers Union Grain Terminal Association, St. Paul regarding Canada and grain imports

Correspondence, newsletters, reports regarding imports of barley; Roy F. Hendrickson to Senators Milton R. Young, Karl E. Mundt, Edward J. Thye (Jan 17, 1954) a super memo on the situation; also reply from Mundt and subsequent eltter of Roy F. Hendrickson to Mundt (Jan 26, 1954) regarding barley import situation

Correspondence includes Milton R. Young, George D. Aiken, Francis Case and statement of M.W. Thatcher, St. Paul (Apr 23, 1953) before Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry; also testimony, C.L. Dickinson, Grange League Federation (Apr 23, 1953)
Includes Roy F. Hendrickson to Non. Franklin Dow, Customs (Dec 3 1952) 6pp. Letter on definition of wheat, unfit for human consumption
Includes 2 copies of USDA Regulations

6 pp. letter-statement of M.W. Thatcher (May 17, 1954) regarding imports of grain and the Agricultural Adjustment Act sent to numerous Senators and Congressmen and some replies to Thatcher statement - including Senators Hubert H. Humphrey, Milton R. Young, William Langer; also, report of US Government regarding Act (Oct 1955) 23 pp. mimeo
Includes letters from Secretary of Agriculture, Charles F. Brannen (Sep 10, 1952); also letter True D. Morse, and from some members of Congress, as Milton R. Young and Edward J. Thye

did.unittitle: Import Quotas - Wallace letter regarding Feed grains

scopecontent.p: Includes copy of letter Henry A. Wallace, to Secretary of Treasurery (Feb 1, 1953) 3 pp. regarding "unfit for human consumption" and Roy F. Hendrickson sending it to Congressmen in 1954
Roy F. Hendrickson (Dec 21, 1954) to Walter C. Berger, Commodity Stabilization Service, 3pp on durum wheat and some comments from Congressmen regarding that letter and situation in Congress

did.unittitle: Wheat Unfit for Human Consumption - S 1313 Bill

scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Roy F. Hendrickson and Congressman regarding NFGC and their support for the bill, includes H. Carl Anderson, House, Minnesota and Milton R. Young and Don L. Short

Correspondence includes Roy F. Hendrickson to Karl D. Loos, Solicitor, USDA (Jan 26, 1954) on unfit wheat, letters and reports; E.J. Bell, Grain and Feed Division, USDA (Feb 11, 1965) to Roy F. Hendrickson on Canadian wheat; clippings; statement, Roy F. Hendrickson (Jun 10, 1953), Senate Judiciary Committee on S. 784 unfit wheat; 12 pp. mimeo

Includes correspondence, reports and clippings regarding oats and imports; Roy F. Hendrickson to Milton R. Young (Sep 1, 1953) and Young to Roy F. Hendrickson (Aug 25, 1953) on quotas and also general farm situation; several statements, including Prof L.C. Cunningham, Cornell (Jul 9, 1953) regarding importation of oats; 3 pp. plus tables; "Investigation of Importation of Oats from Canada," USDA, about 30 pp., mimeograph (Oct 15, 1952)

Statement and correspondence on rye and imports; Roy F. Hendrickson statement (Jun 15, 1955), 6 pp, US Tariff Commission; correspondence on rye situation and includes Hubert H. Humphrey, Milton R. Young, Lawrence F. O'Brien, Dean Acheson, Karl E. Mundt, Edward J. Thye

did.unittitle: Imports of Canadian Grain - Defense Production Act

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, statements, bills, public laws; Roy F. Hendrickson statement (May 29, 1952), 4 pp., tables, mimeo; letters from Congressmen indicating receipt of Roy F. Hendrickson letter on import of grain; reference to article CORNELL LAW REVIEW by Edwin G. Martin on trade agreements and price supports, (ca. 1951-1952); Roy F. Hendrickson to M.W. Thatcher (Jun 6, 1952) on amendments where H spells out why amendments lost; see also Roy F. Hendrickson to Mr. James R. Bliss, Lansing, Michigan
Statement, Roy F. Hendrickson 9pp., tables, mimeo, 3 copies
Statement, Roy F. Hendrickson 8 pp., tables, 2 copies
Statement, Roy F. Hendrickson, Senate Agriculture Committee, 7 pp., mimeo, 3 copies
Statement, M.W. Thatcher, 7 pp., Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry, 1 copy

did.unittitle: Imports of Flaxseed and Linseed Oil

scopecontent.p: Statement, Roy F. Hendrickson, 2 pp., U.S. Tariff Commission, 1 copy
Roy F. Hendrickson to Marvin L. McLain, Commodity Stabilization Service, USDA, 2 pp.

Correspondence, news release includes Milton R. Young (Apr 10, 1954) on barley situation and on the Secretary Henry A. Wallace letter (Feb 1, 1953) which he says "I can make good use of the material contained in the Secretary's letter." also Congressman N. Dakota with USDA
Statement, Roy F. Hendrickson, 10 pp., U.S. Tariff Commission, 1 copy
Statement, Roy F. Hendrickson, 8 pp., Weed Society of America, 1 copy
Correspondence on "screenings" include Mr. William H. Gee, Seattle, Washington; USDA 1955 grain screenings; Clifford R. Hope, House, Kansas, 1947 import of grain

did.unittitle: Imports of Canadian Wheat, Unfit for Human Consumption Report, Bureau of Customs

scopecontent.p: Fiscal year ended Jun 30, 1952; relating to importation of Wheat Classified as Unfit for Human Consumption, 16 pp., mimeograph, 2 copies

scopecontent.p: Roy F. Hendrickson, 7 pp., mimeograph Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry, 1 copy

did.unittitle: Imports of Canadian Wheat, Unfit for Human Consumption Statement

scopecontent.p: Roy F. Hendrickson, 8 pp., Senate Judiciary Committee, 2 copies
Correspondence on hearings on unfit wheat and the definition of "unfit"; numerous Congressman correspondents; Milton R. Young, Herman Welker, etc.
Mostly information on early 1950s
Includes "Wheat and Wheat Flour" Report 145, Second Series, U.S. Tariff Commission, Washington
